title: Hello, Math!
text:
We have the monotonicity of \(L^p\) norms on a probability space: if \(p \ge q\), then \(\|f\|_p \le \|f\|_q\).


Code
# a tiny numerical check
import numpy as np
rng = np.random.default_rng(0)
x = rng.standard_normal(10_000)
p, q = 4, 2
lhs = (np.mean(np.abs(x)**p))**(1/p)
rhs = (np.mean(np.abs(x)**q))**(1/q)
float(lhs), float(rhs), lhs <= rhs


(1.3103108156125425, 0.9980968207275173, np.False_)


A citation example Barenblatt (1952) shows how references appear. See the source of this post for details.




References

Barenblatt, G. I. 1952. “On Self-Similar Motions of Compressible Fluids in Porous Media.” Prikl. Mat. Mekh. 16 (6): 679–98.

title: About
text:
I’m a PhD student in applied mathematics at the CEREMADE laboratory attached to the University Paris Dauphine–PSL. My research touches functional inequalities, PDE, and spectral theory. The PhD is supervised by Jean Dolbeault and David Gontier.

Email: name [at] example.com
GitHub: https://github.com/yourname

This site is built with Quarto and published on GitHub Pages.
